featured.text: Both issues result from the tide of violence that has crossed the region in recent years.
The paths of various religions also crossed here: Muslims have lived peacefully with Christians and Buddhists on the islands for centuries.
“It’s a really hard thing to determine when they’ve crossed the line,” Mr. Power said.
Others say the patients may need to engage in sports outside of their usual, main sport (that is, to cross-train), at least some of the time.
Few of them understood that on their way they would have to cross a harsh wilderness.

other.text: In the cross-lake swimming race, a boat will be _____ in case of an emergency.
Intersections will operate in a way that cars automatically adjust their speed to cross through, while maintaining safe distances from other vehicles.
Although 25. (A) that (B) where (C) which (D) who 26. (A) shows off (B) crosses out (C) brings up (D) turns out 27.
Still others say the safest thing to do is cross-train all the time until the pain is gone.

definition.zh_def: 交叉，十字形的形狀或符號。
definition.en_def: To go across or intersect; a shape or symbol resembling a 'X'.
definition.example: They decided to cross the street at the crosswalk.
